meanings.definition: To cover or mark with smut.
meanings.sent1: She was smutting the paper with charcoal drawings.
meanings.sent2: The fireplace was smutting the walls with ash.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child was caught smutting the mirror with fingerprints.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds were smutting the sky with darkness.
meanings.sent5: The artist was smutting the canvas with bold strokes of paint.

meanings.sent1: The corn was smutting due to a fungal infection.
meanings.sent2: The wheat fields were smutting from the disease.
meanings.sent3: The computer screen started smutting with strange pixels after the power surge.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was smutting with worry as the deadline approached.
meanings.sent5: The garden was smutting with pests, causing the plants to wither.

meanings.sent1: The rain was smutting her white dress with mud.
meanings.sent2: The exhaust from the old car was smutting the air with pollution.
meanings.sent3: The naughty puppy was smutting the carpet with muddy paw prints.
meanings.sent4: The gossip was smutting her reputation with false stories.
meanings.sent5: The ink was smutting the paper, creating a messy blot.
